reason: They make 98 dollars off each t-shirt sold. During the Arkansas game and the Texas tech game they sold a total of 163 t-shirts. If they sold 89 t-shirts during the Arkansas game, then they sold 163 - 89 = 74 t-shirts during the Texas tech game. So they made 98 * 89 = 8712 dollars during the Arkansas game.

problem:
There are 20 different books in the ' crazy silly school ' series. If you are yet to read 5 of the books
How many books have you already read?
reason: There are 20 books in the series. If you have not read 5 of them, then you have read 20 - 5 = 15 books.

problem:

How much money did they make from selling the t-shirts?
reason: They make 62 dollars off each t-shirt. They sold 183 t-shirts. So they made 62 * 183 dollars.

problem:
Being his favorite, he saved checking on the grapevines for his last stop. He was told by 235 of the pickers that they fill 100 drums of raspberries per day and 221 drums of grapes per day.
How many drums of grapes would be filled in 77 days?
reason: 235 pickers fill 100 drums of raspberries per day and 221 drums of grapes per day. So in 77 days, they would fill 77 * 221 = 17,017 drums of grapes.

problem:
Each pack of dvds costs 107 dollars. If there is a discount of 106 dollars on each pack
How many packs of dvds can you buy with 93 dollars?
reason: Each pack of dvds costs 107 dollars. If there is a discount of 106 dollars on each pack, then the cost is 107 - 106 = 1 dollar. So you can buy 93 packs of dvds.

problem:
Together Adam and Jackie have 6 apples. He has 4 apples more than adam and jackie together do.
How many apples does he have?
reason: Adam and Jackie have 6 apples. He has 4 more than that. So he has 6 + 4 = 10 apples.

problem:
We ordered 9 pizzas. Each pizza has 10 slices. If there are 2 of us
How many slices of pizza does each of us get if distributed equally?
reason: There are 9 pizzas. Each pizza has 10 slices. So there are 9 * 10 = 90 slices. If there are 2 people, then each person gets 90 / 2 = 45 slices.

problem:

How many bookshelves does he have?
reason: Bryan has 42 books. Each bookshelf contains 2 books. So 42 / 2 = 21.

problem:
A farmer had 160 tomatoes in his garden. If he picked 56 of them yesterday and 41 today.
How many did he have left after yesterday's picking?
reason: The farmer had 160 tomatoes. He picked 56 yesterday. So he had 160 - 56 = 104 tomatoes left after yesterday's picking.

problem:
Baker made 134 pastries and 11 cakes. If he sold 140 cakes and 92 pastries
How many more pastries than cakes did baker make?
reason: Baker made 134 pastries and 11 cakes. So he made 134 + 11 = 145 pastries and cakes. He sold 140 cakes and 92 pastries. So he sold 140 + 92 = 232 pastries and cakes. So he made 145 pastries and cakes, but sold 232 pastries and cakes. So he has 232 - 145 = 87 pastries and cakes left.

problem:
There are 384 oranges and 192 bananas in Philip's collection. If the bananas are organized into 345 groups and oranges are organized into 16 groups
How big is each group of oranges?
reason: There are 384 oranges and 192 bananas. The bananas are organized into 345 groups. So each group has 192 / 345 = 0.5555555555555556 bananas. The oranges are organized into 16 groups. So each group has 384 / 16 = 24 oranges.

problem:
Jack received 3 emails and 64 letters in the morning. He then received 5 emails and 54 letters in the afternoon.
How many emails did jack receive in the day?
reason: Jack received 3 emails in the morning. In the afternoon, he received 5 more emails. So he received 3 + 5 = 8 emails in the day.

problem:
Allan brought 2 balloons and Jake brought 6 balloons to the park. Allan then bought 3 more balloons at the park.
How many more balloons did Jake have than Allan in the park?
reason: Allan brought 2 balloons. Jake brought 6 balloons. Allan bought 3 more balloons. So Allan had 2 + 3 = 5 balloons. Jake had 6 balloons. So Jake had 6 - 5 = 1 more balloon than Allan.

problem:

How many peaches does Jake have?
reason: Steven has 19 peaches. Jake has 12 fewer peaches than Steven. So Jake has 19 - 12 = 7 peaches. Jake has 72 more peaches than Jill. So Jill has 72 - 7 = 65 peaches.

problem:

How many bird families flew away for the winter?
reason: 38 bird families flew away to africa. 80 bird families flew away to asia. So 38 + 80 = 118 bird families flew away.

problem:

reason: Jake brought 6 balloons to the park. Then he bought 3 more. So he brought 6 + 3 = 9 balloons to the park.

problem:

How many boys did she give the marbles to?
reason: Haley had 10 marbles. She gave 5 marbles to each boy. So she gave 5 * 10 = 50 marbles.

problem:

How many more peaches does Jake have than Jill?
reason: Steven has 5 peaches. Jill has 8 fewer peaches than Steven. So Jill has 5 - 8 = -3 peaches. Jake has 3 fewer peaches than Steven. So Jake has 5 - 3 = 2 peaches. Jake has 2 more peaches than Jill.

problem:

reason: The shop made 51 dollars from selling 3 t-shirts. So each t-shirt cost 51 / 3 = 17 dollars.

problem:

How many cakes would baker still have?
reason: Baker started with 155 cakes. His friend bought 140 cakes. So he has 155 - 140 cakes left. 155 - 140 is 15.

problem:
The Ferris wheel in paradise park has 6 seats. Each seat can hold 14 people. If there are 16 people on the wheel right now
How many more people can join the wheel?
reason: The Ferris wheel has 6 seats. Each seat can hold 14 people. So the total number of people the Ferris wheel can hold is 6 * 14 = 84. If there are 16 people on the wheel right now, then 84 - 16 = 68 more people can join the wheel.

problem:
Katie had 78 new games and 86 old games. Her friends had 48 new games.
How many new games do they have together?
reason: Katie had 78 new games. Her friends had 48 new games. So together they had 78 + 48 = 126 new games.

problem:

How many pieces of candy are in each bag?
reason: Frank put some pieces of candy equally into 2 bags. So each bag has the same number of pieces. If he had 16 pieces of candy, then each bag has 16 / 2 = 8 pieces of candy.

problem:

How many nails does John need for the house wall?
reason: John needs 2 nails for each plank. He needs 16 planks. So he needs 2 * 16 = 32 nails.

problem:

How many apples did rachel pick?
reason: Rachel started with 4 apples. After picking some, she had 2 left. So she picked 4 - 2 = 2 apples.

problem:
Rebecca wants to split a collection of eggs into groups of 5. Rebecca has 10 marbles and 15 eggs.
How many groups will be created?
reason: Rebecca has 10 marbles and 15 eggs. She wants to split the eggs into groups of 5. So she will have 15 / 5 = 3 groups of eggs.

problem:
If Lewis earns $ 1357 every week during the 223 weeks of a harvest season.
How much money will he earn if he works for 73 harvest seasons?
reason: Lewis earns $1357 every week. There are 223 weeks in a harvest season. So he earns $1357 * 223 = $299,911 every harvest season. If he works for 73 harvest seasons, then he earns $299,911 * 73 = $21,794,323.

problem:
Carol was sending out birthday invitations to her friends. Each package of invitations she bought had 10 invitations in it and she bought 7 packs. If she sends invitations to only 2 friends
How many invitations will be left?
reason: Carol bought 7 packs of invitations. Each pack had 10 invitations. So she bought 7 * 10 = 70 invitations. If she sends invitations to only 2 friends, then she will have 70 - 2 = 68 invitations left.

problem:

How many more pastries than cakes did baker make?
reason: Baker made 19 cakes and 131 pastries. He sold 70 cakes and 88 pastries. So he has 19 - 70 cakes left and 131 - 88 pastries left. 19 - 70 is -51. 131 - 88 is 43.

problem:

How many crayons did he get for his birthday?
reason: Paul started with some crayons. By the end of the school year, he had 177 left. So he had some - 551 = 177 crayons left.

problem:

reason: The area of the carpet is 10 square feet. The width of the room is 2 feet. So the length of the room is 10 / 2 = 5 feet.

reason: You have 33 cookies. Each bag has 11 cookies. So you have 33 / 11 = 3 bags of cookies.

problem:

reason: The waiter started with some customers. After 9 left, he had 12 left. So he had 12 + 9 = 21 customers at the start.

problem:

How many more peaches does Steven have than Jill?
reason: Jake has 9 fewer peaches than Steven. So Steven has 9 more peaches than Jake. Steven has 16 peaches. So Jake has 16 - 9 = 7 peaches. Jake has 18 more peaches than Jill. So Jill has 7 - 18 = -11 peaches. Steven has 16 peaches. Jill has -11 peaches. So Steven has 16 - (-11) = 27 more peaches than Jill.

problem:

reason: Jerry started with 4 action figures. He added some more. Now there are 8. So he added 8 - 4 = 4 action figures.

problem:

How many more crayons did he give to his friends than those he lost?
reason: Paul started with 267 crayons. He lost 231 crayons. 267 - 231 = 36. He gave away 308 crayons. 36 + 308 = 344.

problem:

How many bottles did they have total?
reason: The grocery store had 57 bottles of regular soda, 26 bottles of diet soda and 27 bottles of lite soda. So they had 57 + 26 + 27 bottles. 57 + 26 + 27 is 100.

problem:

How many more chairs will they have to buy?
reason: There are 4 sets of tables. Each set has 3 chairs. So there are 4 * 3 = 12 chairs. 14 people will attend the party. So they need 14 - 12 = 2 more chairs.

problem:

reason: Haley had 12 trees. 2 trees died. So she has 12 - 2 = 10 trees left.

problem:

reason: Randy started with 79 blocks. He used 14 blocks to build a tower and 11 blocks to build a house. So he used 14 + 11 = 25 blocks. 79 - 25 = 54.

problem:
